title: Intersectionality-Based Educational Design and Feminist Autoethnographic Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Competency in mathematics curriculum design, foundational knowledge of educational technology, and multicultural education experience
context.additional_context: Exploring how pre-service teachers can reflect on intersectional discrimination structures experienced in mathematics education settings and incorporate these insights into instructional design.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze at least three potential bias elements in the instructional design process using a feminist intersectional approach.
Learners can critically reflect on power dynamics in their educational practices by applying autoethnographic techniques.
Learners can develop one or more lesson models that integrate intersectional concepts into mathematics curriculum design.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
